intro: Guarea zepivae, commonly known as the Guarea tree, is a species native to the tropical rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes trees known for their aromatic wood and medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its role in forest regeneration. Guarea zepivae is also valued for its hard, durable wood, which has been used by indigenous communities for construction and tool-making.
